result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Albrecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AS OF 9/11/19 - CONTACT CAN BE PERMITTED AS DOC DETERMINES.  
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  May Not have contact with Olivia A, Lauren A or her family or residences, Known drug users or felons.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  SW Rachel Merino appeared and gave statement.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 2; 6 months conditional jail w/Huber privileges; deft to report to jail on 4/16/16 at 6pm; credit for 1 day served if revoked; pay prosecution costs of $43 (by stipulation of deft); deft to pay $500 DNA surcharge, bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster; no contact w/Olivia A., Lauren A. or her residence or family, no known drug users or felons.
from Atty Parise.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  Court orders prosecution costs of $43.00 (stipulated to by deft).  SEH 4/11/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Parise reports that the case is resolved.  By agreement of Atty Parise and ADA Delgado the pending motions do not need to be heard.  JS of 1/19/16 at 8:30am is cancelled and a plea hearing is set for 2/4/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
